alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Jasper and eastern Jones Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 343 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Soso, or 8 miles northwest of Laurel, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Laurel around 400 PM CDT. Tuckers Crossing around 405 PM CDT. Mill Creek around 410 PM CDT. Ovett around 420 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, southeastern and east central Mississippi.
